main_definition: Agreements refer to the understanding or arrangement between two or more parties, typically involving a set of terms that are accepted by all involved.

meanings_and_examples.example: After months of talks, both companies finally came to an agreement on the contract's terms.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A formal document that outlines agreed-upon conditions between parties
meanings_and_examples.example: The signing of the non-disclosure agreements by all involved signifies their commitment to confidentiality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An understanding or arrangement based on mutual consent, without legal obligations
meanings_and_examples.example: They shook hands and reached a verbal agreement about sharing responsibilities for the project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A common ground or shared belief among multiple parties
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite their differences, they all agreed that improving environmental conservation was crucial.
